title: So Thornmail is getting changed in 7.14 on Wed...
body: ...which overall I'm fairly excited for, especially since it's getting health and the new item that build into it, Bramble Vest. But here's a question: why is it being built from Warden's Mail? You know, the item that lowers the attack speed of people who hit those with it. Why is this part of it's build path though when it's an item that's pretty much suppose to punish those who are heavily reliant on AA for damage (ADC's, Yi, Tryn, etc.) Isn't that a bit counter productive for the purpose of the item to slow down attacks if the whole point is to let them attack and die off of you?

replies.body:
all i wanted was to have blademail from dota 

now we've got a busted-ass item for 900 gold

I don't understand why they ever started to change it from:

+a buttton of armor
+ return 30% of AA damage as magic damage

It's effective, and still needs HP to back it up. None of these convoluted armor scalings and piddly damage charts. Although I will say that the Grevious Wounds is a good idea. You can't build Mortal Reminder or Morellonomicon on tanks most of the time.
It's being shifted towards an anti healing item than an anti AA item.  It'd be broken as both.
